timeline.bodyText: If you rebase off master there is a configProvider.getEnum which would clean this up I think. The configuration parameter would be defined by the enum values themselves.
timeline.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText: As we commented offline, there is no a configProvider instance in CoreTracer yet. This will be refactored in the future.
replies.author: drodriguezhdez

timeline.bodyText:
I think rather than Queue; this should either be...
 create(Queue primary, Queue secondary)
OR
create(Queue<List> primary, Queue<List> secondary)
timeline.author: dougqh

replies.bodyText: There was a discussion about this at the time. Accepting Object allows the flush messages and avoids allocating wrappers, but it has downsides, so we don't want this ever escaping the package.
replies.author: richardstartin
